channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: TeraWulf increases self-mined BTC in Q2 while Hut8 looks to USBTC merger
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Gareth Jenkinson
item.description: U.S. miner TeraWulf expanded its Bitcoin mining capacity in 2023, resulting in 70% more BTC mined in in Q2.

item.title: Coinbase VP says Canada can be a ‘global leader’ in crypto
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: The cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase officially launched in Canada in August 2023 and is expanding its service offerings amid a promising local crypto climate.

item.title: Metaverse project The Sandbox unlocks $133M worth of tokens
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: The next batch of token unlocks for The Sandbox is on Feb. 14, 2024, and will unfreeze over 200 million SAND for its team, company reserve and advisors.

item.title: Crypto adoption crosses party lines amid Washington’s political deadlock
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Stephen Katte
item.description: Support for crypto among United States politicians and voters appears to be crossing party lines with bipartisanship agreements.

item.title: FedNow showcases DLT-powered payments system as service provider
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: The Federal Reserve wrote that it does not support or endorse any showcase providers featured on its website.

item.title: 13% of applications approved: British regulator discloses crypto registration stats
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By David Attlee
item.description: Since January 2020, almost 300 crypto companies have applied for registration with the Financial Conduct Authority, 38 of which were approved.

item.title: Anthropic AI raises $100M from South Korea to bolster telecommunications industry
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: Google-backed AI developer Anthropic raised $100 million in funding from South Korean telecommunications giant SK Telecom to bolster the industry.

item.title: Here’s what happened in crypto today
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Serge Egon Ostman
item.category: why did the Fed pause rates
item.description: Need to know what happened in crypto today? Here is the latest news on daily trends and events impacting Bitcoin price, blockchain, DeFi, NFTs, Web3 and crypto regulation.

item.title: BTC price breakout by end of August? 5 things to know in Bitcoin this week
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Bitcoin stays frustratingly quiet after the weekly close, but BTC price forecasts are giving ever-shorter breakout deadlines.

item.title: PayPal to roll out Cryptocurrencies Hub for select users
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Arijit Sarkar
item.description: The Cryptocurrencies Hub is key for PayPal to reinvent itself as a crypto-inclusive platform. The service will allow for the sale and purchase of cryptocurrencies, among other functionalities.

item.title: Pro-Bitcoin Javier Milei wins most votes in Argentina primary election
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: Argentine presidential hopeful Javier Milei — a pro-Bitcoin, anti-central bank libertarian — has won a majority of the votes in a primary election.

item.title: Nifty News: Coca-Cola gets Based, Reddit avatars reach 20M milestone and more
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Martin Young
item.description: Coca-Cola has chosen the newly-launched Coinbase layer-2 network Base to deploy its Masterpiece NFT collection.

item.title: Coinbase app is ‘broken’ for UX, admits CEO Brian Armstrong
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Mitchelhill
item.description: Brian Armstrong said the next two weeks will see a series of rapid updates on the biggest pain points for Coinbase app users.

item.title: Weekend Wrap: Uniswap dev sacked for alleged rug, Steadefi hacker goes mixing and more
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brayden Lindrea
item.description: Uniswap developer AzFlin has admitted to creating the FRENS token but has argued what he did doesn’t constitute a rug pull.

item.title: Sam Bankman-Fried spends 3rd night in notorious New York jail
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: The former FTX CEO has swapped his parent’s cozy California home for the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn, which isn’t known for its comforts.

item.title: This scenario could see Gensler replaced by SEC's Crypto Mom: Former SEC official
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Mitchelhill
item.description: John Reed Stark believes SEC chair Gary Gensler could throw in the towel, depending on a possible scenario to play out in 2024.

item.title: Zunami Protocol confirms stablecoin pools attacked, $2.1M loss estimated
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brayden Lindrea
item.description: Blockchain security firm PeckShield estimates the protocol suffered more than $2.1 million from the price manipulation attack.

item.title: An ETF will bring a revolution for Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Calvin Shen
item.description: A Bitcoin ETF is on the cusp of receiving approval in the United States — and it may not be long before we see one in Hong Kong or elsewhere in Asia.

item.title: Bitcoin’s sideways price action leads traders to focus on SHIB, UNI, MKR and XDC
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Rakesh Upadhyay
item.description: SHIB, UNI, MKR and XDC show signs of strength even as Bitcoin price remains stuck inside a narrow range.

item.title: Voyager’s token transfer to Coinbase sparks sell-off suspicions
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Amaka Nwaokocha
item.description: The motive behind the transactions has triggered speculation within the broader crypto community.

item.title: Legal scholars file amicus brief in support of Coinbase
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Amaka Nwaokocha
item.description: The legal practitioners asked the court to adhere to the established definition of “investment contract” when interpreting its scope.

item.title: Bitcoin bought by corporate giants should not be feared — Michael Saylor
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ciaran Lyons
item.description: During a recent podcast interview, Michael Saylor explained that Bitcoin being bought and custodied by corporations should not be feared, outlining three main reasons driving the need for custodians.

item.title: Using courts for every crypto issue will squash innovation — Grayscale CEO
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ciaran Lyons
item.description: Grayscale CEO Michael Sonnenshein emphasized the need for a balanced regulatory approach to cryptocurrency to avoid hindering innovation in the United States.

item.title: SBF ordered to jail, Bitcoin ETF delayed and SEC to appeal Ripple case: Hodler’s Digest, Aug. 6-12
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Editorial Staff
item.description: Sam Bankman-Fried has bail revoked, ordered to jail; the SEC delays decision on a spot Bitcoin ETF; and the SEC moves to appeal on Ripple’s case.

item.title: Brazil’s Congress moves to levy higher taxes on cryptocurrencies
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: If approved, the legislation would make crypto assets held by Brazilians overseas subject to the same tax rules governing traditional assets.

item.title: Bitcoin has bottomed despite ‘astonishing’ BTC price action — Analyst
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Bitcoin is due to offer nothing beyond a “classic weekend chop” as signs of change on BTC price charts continue to flow in.

item.title: CFTC charges residents of Florida, Louisiana, Arkansas with crypto fraud
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Amaka Nwaokocha
item.description: The regulatory body claims the defendants enticed over 14,000 individuals by creating false weekly returns.

item.title: Curve Finance vows to reimburse users after $62M hack
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Amaka Nwaokocha
item.description: The platform said it would assess each impacted user for reimbursement.

item.title: DeFi tries to recover from Curve hack, but exploits continue: Finance Redefined
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: Binance jumped in with a $5 million Curve token investment to help with efforts to minimize the risk of contagion.

item.title: Victim of 90 ETH exploit set to claw funds back after hacker was blacklisted
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: The hacker’s wallet, with over $100,000 worth of USDT, was blacklisted and frozen, while the victim had been drained of almost $170,000 worth of NFTs and other assets.
